intro: Daucus parviflorus, commonly known as the small-flowered carrot, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes other familiar plants like carrots and parsley. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are finely divided and resemble those of other carrot relatives. It is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is considered a rare species.
